names.english: decoction for regulating the flow of qi
names.commonEnglish: Decoction for Regulating the Flow of Qi

actions: Promotes movement of Qi, descends Qi, regulates the Middle, dispels Cold, warms the Spleen and Stomach, stops vomiting and alleviates pain.
With Mu Xiang, for rebellious Middle Jiao Qi with belching, hiccup, nausea and vomiting, epigastric and abdominal distention, a stifling sensation in the epigastrium and diarrhea.
Promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
Breaks up Blood Stasis, invigorates Blood circulation and drains abscesses.
Resolves Phlegm and softens areas of hardness.
Reduces Phlegm and softens areas of hardness.
With Kun Bu, for goiter and scrofula.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold, reduces swelling, expels pus, generates flesh and alleviates pain.
Regulates Qi, adjusts the Middle, relieves the diaphragm, dries Dampness, descends Qi and transforms Phlegm.
Calms the Liver and strongly descends rebellious Qi.
